variants.Description in input context: L166P mutation leads to loss of function and protein instability
G46S mutation causes reduced enzyme activity and misfolding

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with plasmids encoding mutant and wild-type DJ-1

Readout description.Result Description: L166P variant showed significantly reduced protein stability and cytoplasmic localization
G46S variant exhibited reduced enzyme activity and misfolding compared to wild-type

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each transfection experiment

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate for Western blot quantification

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 plasmid was used as a positive control

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection served as a negative control

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for comparing mutant vs. wild-type results

Material used.Description: Enzyme activity was measured in HEK293 cells expressing mutant DJ-1

Readout description.Result Description: G46S variant showed 40% reduction in enzyme activity compared to wild-type

Biological replicates.Description: Two biological replicates were conducted for enzyme activity measurements

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was tested in duplicate for enzyme activity quantification

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for enzyme activity

Basic negative control.Description: Cells without DJ-1 expression served as negative controls

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to analyze enzyme activity data across multiple experiments
